title: Recieved a 2 week ban
body:
Well, this is a rough start to the year. I am very worried and don't want to lose this account after this. I said some really stupid crap out of frustration and even tried apologizing afterward. I think I should take a step back from this game for a while to reflect and manage a better positive outlook not just in the game but in life. It's difficult when you realize that you become part of the problem in the community here with toxicity. I'm sorry, and I'll do better next time I'm on the rift.

Take Care.

> Thought I'd give the post a bump but it's been several months since this happened and I've remained ban free since and even reached back up to Honor 2 at the final checkpoint just before the season reset :) I even got to Silver 2! I'm not perfect in any way and but I feel a ton better with myself.

Just want to note that, unless it was changed recently, even after taking a break away from the game you'll still be on thin ice. You can only go down tiers by playing games.

Your best bet, when you come back, is to /mute all, as you already said you plan to do.

If you do speak, make sure it's helpful. And don't over use pings. Such as pinging baron and suggesting baron, or doing the mia ping on Baron and saying you think they may be at baron.

Do your best to not let anything get to you, I recommend calming music as well as taking a break after games. Taking a break after a game or two is a good way to calm down and make sure you want to continue.

Good luck when you come back.

My recent post about this situation because of just HOW EASY it is to receive your permaban now. Be careful man, would hate to see you struggle with what so many others have struggled with.

In the presence of horrible matchmaking resolve to make it through to the end cleanly. 

The 1st priority isn't winning, it's protecting your vulnerable account.

Fullmute all and block emotes, then ride the game out and take a break afterwards. 

Be sure to group for objectives and defend the nexus, even if it seems pointless.

Do your best to identify when you're titling early on. Remember during those times that the first priority is keeping your account safe. Saying it out loud and taking a few deep breaths may help.

Good luck

In all honesty the safest way to not get permabanned after 14 day ban is to disable chat permanently, because it takes only 1 flaming game now instead of 3 for the other level of bans, just 1 game and your account is gone.  You can play the game, just disable the chat, unbind the z button or something, I think it can be done, check on the internet.

Listen to some chill music, send in a ticket to Riot Support to give you a 25-game chat restriction (it helps a lot) and just in general try to play league while in a mindset of "playing for fun" rather than just playing to win.

Good luck!
